question: In what way do vector databases differ from traditional databases in handling complex data types?
options: Vector databases can only handle numeric data types.
Vector databases require less storage space for complex data types.
Vector databases are optimized for high-dimensional vector data.
Traditional databases are more efficient in processing high-dimensional data.
correct_answer: Vector databases are optimized for high-dimensional vector data.
explanation: Vector databases are specifically designed to handle high-dimensional vector data efficiently, unlike traditional databases.
